lines.text: Everywhere I go, there's always an asshole.
You know some of you guys have some cute little asses. It'd be a real shame if I had to blow'em off.

[Ben has just told them where Ellen is being hidden]
Pay him.
Yeah, pay me!
I'm not gonna pay this jerk.
Listen, shithead, you give him some of your money, or I'll give him some of your money.
You're real dumb if you think you can pull this off.
I think you're forgetting something. I got the gun.
I can get guns, smart guy, lots of. Now... why don't you tell me your name?
Tom Cody. Pleased to meet ya.
Hey you always walk around packed?
I told you, I'm a soldier.
Well, don't go pointin' that thing at me, I wouldn't like it.
I don't go pointin' it unless I'm gonna use it.
Yeah, right.
I've been a soldier, 'til I ran out of wars.
Oh, you're dumb. And, you're short. Real short.
Well, it looks like I finally found someone who likes to play as rough as I do.

Look, I know you're gonna be going places with your music and stuff and... and I'm not the kind of guy to be carrying your guitars along for you. But if you ever need me for something... I'll be there.
You know, no one ever had a hold me like you did. I would have done anything for you. A long time ago I would have thought you were worthy of it. Not anymore, babe.

[telling his sister goodbye before leaving to rescue Ellen]
Don't worry about it. They always hire bums like me for jobs like this.
There's no point in stealing a car if you're not going to wring it out.
Try it again punk.
We're gonna play a little game, you Bombers are gonna like it, it's called lights out.
Take it easy, Cody.
I'll take it where I can get it.
The only problem with kicking the shit out of you is that it would be too easy.
You smart guys. You always think you can hire a bum like me to do your dirty work. Well not this time!
Some people that never talk about their feelings got 'em deeper than anybody. Other people never talk about their feelings 'cause they ain't got any.
I've always been a tequila man.
I liked shooting the guns... but I didn't win no medal.
You wanna change this tire, shorty?
Changing tires isn't exactly my line of work, dear.
If that's the case, then why don't you just shut up!
Let's see the color of your money.
Are we going to talk about it, or are we going to do it?
Hey look, I did real good back there.
So what, I'm all out of medals.

The famous Sorels sure put a lot of money into that bus, huh? Listen Cody, I didn't know you had a thing with Ellen in the old days, but you better get some smarts and learn to adjust to the fact that you're out of the picture now. See Cody, I do things for her. Things that a guy like you could never do. Things that matter in the real world.
You know something? The only trouble with kicking the shit out of you is it would be too easy.
I'll be comin' for her. I'll be comin' for you too.
Sure you will. And I'll be waitin.'
My plan fell to shit. Let's see what you can do.
OK Fish, you head back to the car. I want you in that doorway over there in fifteen minutes. And I mean fifteen minutes.
Are you crazy? They'll notice me in a second down there.
Don't worry about that, I'm gonna give them a couple of other things to worry about.
What about her? I thought she's supposed to do the driving!
Get moving, and you better be ready when we get there.
Do you trust him, or are you just desperate?
You take the front entrance, I'm going topside. If you can work your way upstairs to help me out, fine. If not, I'll handle it.
Just what I always wanted to do, Cody. Take on the Bombers.
